base: Kabrit, Egypt (primary); Luqa, Malta (detachment from 17 Oct 1942)

operations_history.operation: Western Desert Campaign - Pursuit of Axis forces

metadata.notes: Wellington Mk II confirmed from multiple Tier 1/2 sources. Squadron operated split operations between Kabrit (Egypt) and Malta detachment from 17 October 1942. Bases confirmed: Kabrit (primary), LG 224 (7-12 Nov), LG 104 (12-27 Nov), LG 237 (27 Nov onwards), Luqa Malta (detachment 17 Oct - 21 Jan 1943). Personnel and ordnance estimates based on standard RAF Wellington squadron establishment 1942. Commander name not found in available sources. WITW airType 632 = Wellington bomber. Squadron part of 205 (Heavy Bomber) Group providing night strategic bombing support to 8th Army during El Alamein and pursuit operations. Known loss: Wellington II Z8469 EP-F on 17 Dec 1942 (claimed by German night fighter). Hybrid source validation: Unit designation and battles from Wikipedia, aircraft variants and bases from Tier 1/2 sources.
metadata.witw_validation: Confirmed in WITW _airgroup.csv: No.104 RAF LB Sqn, player=2 (British), airType=632 (Wellington bomber), 16 total aircraft, 250 delay, morale 74/74
